title: System shuts down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of changes in the .txt file. The system shuts down/reboots immediately without any warning or prompt to save files.
EB: Upon initiating a shutdown/reboot while a WSWB session with unsaved .txt files is active, the system should prompt users to save their work before proceeding with the shutdown/reboot process.
SR:
1. Launch WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file within the project and add content to it.
3. Observe that the text file is marked as 'dirty' (unsaved).
4. Left-click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down' command to initiate the shutdown/reboot process.
5. Note the absence of any warning or message prompting to save unsaved files before the system shuts down/reboots.
